name: hajee-oracle
author: Bert Hajee
summary: the custom types needed to manage the basic setup of an Oracle database
description: the custom types needed to manage the basic setup of an Oracle database. It contains: tablespace, oracle_user, grant etc

types.name: listener
types.doc: This is the oracle listener process

properties.name: ensure
properties.doc:
Whether a listener should be running.

Valid values are `stopped` (also called `false`), `running` (also called `true`).

parameters.name: name
parameters.doc: The name of the listner to run.

types.name: oracle_service
types.doc: This resource allows you to manage a service in an Oracle database.

properties.name: ensure
properties.doc:
The basic property that the resource should be in.

Valid values are `present`, `absent`.

providers.name: simple
providers.doc: Manage Oracle services via regular SQL

types.name: oracle_user
types.doc: This resource allows you to manage a user in an Oracle database.

properties.name: ensure
properties.doc:
The basic property that the resource should be in.

Valid values are `present`, `absent`.

properties.name: user_id
properties.doc: The user id

properties.name: default_tablespace
properties.doc: The user's default tablespace

properties.name: temporary_tablespace
properties.doc: The user's temporary tablespace

properties.name: quotas
properties.doc: quota's for this user

properties.name: grants
properties.doc: grants for this user

providers.name: simple
providers.doc: Manage Oracle users in an Oracle Database via regular SQL

types.name: role
types.doc: This resource allows you to manage a role in an Oracle database.

properties.name: ensure
properties.doc:
The basic property that the resource should be in.

Valid values are `present`, `absent`.

properties.name: password
properties.doc: The password

providers.name: simple
providers.doc: Manage an Oracle role in an Oracle Database via regular SQL

types.name: tablespace
types.doc: This resource allows you to manage an Oracle tablespace.

properties.name: ensure
properties.doc:
The basic property that the resource should be in.

Valid values are `present`, `absent`.

properties.name: logging
properties.doc:
TODO: Add description

Valid values are `yes`, `no`.

properties.name: datafile
properties.doc: The name of the datafile

properties.name: size
properties.doc: The size of the tablespace

properties.name: autoextend
properties.doc:
Enable autoextension for the tablespace

Valid values are `on`, `off`.

properties.name: next
properties.doc: Size of the next autoextent

properties.name: max_size
properties.doc: maximum size for autoextending

properties.name: extent_management
properties.doc:
TODO: Give description

Valid values are `local`, `dictionary`.

properties.name: segment_space_management
properties.doc:
TODO: Give description

Valid values are `auto`, `manual`.

properties.name: bigfile
properties.doc:
the type of datafile used for the tablespace

Valid values are `yes`, `no`.

providers.name: simple
providers.doc: Manage an Oracle Tablespace in an Oracle Database via regular SQL
